page.title: 02Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Dyfed
page.content: {Farming}in the area comprises a mixture of{grazing}in the north with an increasing amount of{cereal}crops in the sheltered valley-bottom to the south. Fertile grassland with cattle, and some sheep on rougher pasture is the major land-use.{Cattle}are mainly {Friesian}with an increasing number of {Charelais}as pure-bred stock or Friesian crosses, with some use of {Herefords and Welsh Blacks.} Cattle classes in the{Llandysul}September 85 show comprised{Dairy Shorthorn, {British Friesians, Holsteins, Jerseys, {Charelais and Welsh Blacks.}Dairy farming, formerly an important source of income, is decreasing due to{EEC quota restrictions, and many farmers rely on short term investment in animals as store cattle over winter or for fattening.{Llandysul & Newcastle {Emlyn}have regular{stock sales.
